thread.title: Bethlehem Catholic QB Julian Spigner verbally commits to Lafayette
thread.title_full: Bethlehem Catholic QB Julian Spigner verbally commits to Lafayette

title: Bethlehem Catholic QB Julian Spigner verbally commits to Lafayette
text:
Bethlehem Catholic quarterback Julian Spigner scores a touchdown against Liberty. (lehighvalleylive.com file photo) By Greg Joyce | For lehighvalleylive.com on October 18, 2015 2:33 PM View/Post Comments 
Another local quarterback has decided to take his talents to College Hill. 
Bethlehem Catholic senior Julian Spigner announced on Twitter Sunday he has verbally committed to continue his academic and football career at Lafayette. Proud to announce that I am committing to continue my academic and athletic career at Lafayette College #RollPards pic.twitter.com/dCjJhI22pF 
The 6-foot-3, 195-pound Spigner joins Notre Dame QB Tre Jordan , who gave a verbal commitment last month , in the Leopards' recruiting class. 
Through seven games this year, Spigner is 75 on 122 passing for 1,012 yards, eight touchdowns and no interceptions while adding 62 carries for 356 yards and seven touchdowns. 
RELATED : Year of the QB: Bethlehem Catholic's Julian Spigner, The Catalyst 
Over his career as a Golden Hawk, including three years starting, Spigner is 323-for-560 for 4,838 yards and 54 touchdowns in addition to 314 rushes for 1,548 yards and 14 touchdowns. 
The dual-threat earned all-state honors as a junior when he led Bethlehem Catholic to the PIAA Class AAA quarterfinals. Both of his parents played basketball at Lafayette.
